bioghist.p: Charles Butler was a prominent English Catholic figure who campaigned actively for Catholic Emancipation. In addition to his professional career as a conveyancer and his political activities, Butler was also a prolific writer on a variety of subjects such as law, history, music, English, Scottish and Irish Catholic history, and Holy Scripture.

scopecontent.p: This volume includes a manuscript of a play in verse, written by Butler. The play takes place in Florence in 1745, and has six main characters: Lord Mowbray; Prince di Neri (nephew of the Grand Duke of Florence); Fitzhenry; Desmond; the Marchesa Orsina; and Lady Mowbray. The text includes notes, deletions and revisions.
